section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 18. Chapter 18: Symptoms, signs, and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings, not elsewhere classified (R00-R99) > c. Combination codes that include symptoms

content.full_text: ICD-10-CM contains a number of combination codes that identify both the definitive diagnosis and common symptoms of that diagnosis. When using one of these combination codes, an additional code should not be assigned for the symptom. (Evidence: pg no: 75, L89-L91)
content.summary: When using combination codes that include both diagnosis and symptoms, do not assign additional codes for the symptoms already included in the combination code (Evidence: pg no: 75, L89-L91)
key_concepts: Combination codes in ICD-10-CM (Evidence: pg no: 75, L90)
Definitive diagnosis and symptoms combined (Evidence: pg no: 75, L90-L91)
No additional symptom coding (Evidence: pg no: 75, L91)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign additional codes for symptoms when using combination codes that include those symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 75, L91)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a combination code already captures both the diagnosis and its associated symptoms, separate symptom codes should not be assigned to avoid duplicate coding (Evidence: pg no: 75, L89-L91)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Check if a combination code exists that includes diagnosis and symptoms
Step 3: If combination code available, use it instead of separate codes
Step 4: Do not assign additional symptom codes included in combination code

code_patterns.description: Codes that identify both definitive diagnosis and common symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 75, L90-L91)
code_patterns.explanation: Single codes that capture multiple related conditions

references_to.title: Use of symptom code with definitive diagnosis code
references_to.explanation: Contrasts with scenarios where separate symptom coding is appropriate

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with pneumonia and documented respiratory failure
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient diagnosed with pneumonia complicated by acute respiratory failure. Requiring mechanical ventilation.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify pneumonia as primary diagnosis
Step 2: Note respiratory failure as complication
Step 3: Check for combination code that includes both
Step 4: Use combination code, do not code respiratory failure separately
